summary: This is a transcript of a voluntary sworn interview conducted by the DOJ Office of the Inspector General (OIG) with a former warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York regarding the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The interview covers events from July to August 2019, including the July 23 incident, cellmate selection, the August 10 suicide, and systemic failures in counts, rounds, camera systems, and staff responsibilities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: High-profile inmate who died by suicide in the MCC Special Housing Unit on August 10, 2019. The interview extensively discusses his housing, psychological status, and the circumstances leading to his death.

persons.name: Edward Hayes
persons.context: Attorney representing the interviewee (the former warden). He is present during the OIG interview, makes occasional comments, and clarifies legal points.

persons.name: Efrain Reyes
persons.context: Inmate who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate. He was transferred out of the MCC on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Inmate who was Epstein's cellmate prior to Efrain Reyes. Involved in the July 23, 2019 incident where Epstein was found with injuries; the investigation was inconclusive regarding assault vs. suicide attempt.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: Correctional Officer working in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on the morning of August 10, 2019. She and Michael Thomas were the officers assigned when Epstein was found.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Correctional Officer working in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) on the morning of August 10, 2019. He was the one who found Epstein unresponsive.

persons.name: Darlene Imeri
persons.context: Psychologist at MCC involved in Epstein's psychological observation and suicide watch status. Sent an email on July 30, 2019, stating Epstein needed a cellmate.

persons.name: Mariel Colon
persons.context: One of Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys who made housing requests to MCC staff prior to his death.

persons.name: Joseph Columbo
persons.context: RN who wrote the medical report after responding to the body alarm for Epstein on August 10, 2019, noting Epstein was cold with no pulse.

persons.name: Carlos Perez
persons.context: Operations Lieutenant at MCC. The interview discusses whether he was notified about inmate Reyes's departure and the need to assign Epstein a new cellmate.

persons.name: Kevin Pistro
persons.context: Chief of Staff at the BOP Director's office. The interviewee states he sent cellmate selection information (for Reyes and Tartaglione) to Pistro's office for approval.

persons.name: Norman Reed
persons.context: Unit manager for the witness security (wit sec) unit at MCC. Sent weekly rounds reports to the warden.

connections.description: Reyes was Epstein's cellmate in the SHU. He was transferred out of MCC on August 9, 2019, leaving Epstein without a cellmate.
Tartaglione was Epstein's cellmate prior to Reyes. The July 23 incident involved an inconclusive investigation into whether Tartaglione assaulted Epstein or Epstein attempted suicide.
Edward Hayes is the attorney representing the former warden during the OIG interview.
Both were Correctional Officers working the same shift in the SHU when Epstein was found deceased.
The warden sent cellmate selection information for high-profile inmates to Pistro, the BOP Director's chief of staff, for approval.

events.title: First Incident Involving Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein found in fetal position in his cell with a red neck and possible ligature marks. Investigation was inconclusive as to whether it was a suicide attempt or an assault by cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. Epstein placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Removed from Psychological Observation
events.description: Epstein was taken off psychological observation and returned to the Special Housing Unit (SHU) with a requirement to have a cellmate. An email from psychologist Darlene Imeri notified staff of this requirement.

events.title: Cellmate Reyes Transferred
events.description: Inmate Efrain Reyes, Epstein's cellmate, was transferred out of MCC (With All Belongings/WAB) to a GEO facility per U.S. Marshals Service orders. Epstein was left without a cellmate.

events.title: Unmonitored Phone Call
events.description: Epstein was provided an unmonitored social phone call by the institutional duty officer. He requested to call his mother (who was deceased), a man answered, and the call was not properly monitored.

events.title: Epstein Found Deceased
events.description: At approximately 6:33 a.m., Correctional Officer Michael Thomas found Jeffrey Epstein unresponsive in his cell with a torn bedsheet around his neck. CPR was initiated, and he was pronounced dead at the hospital.

events.title: Warden Removed from MCC
events.description: The interviewee (the warden) was told to report to the regional office and was removed from his position at MCC, though his title remained unchanged until 2020.

locations: 515 Madison Avenue, 31st floor, New York, NY (location of interview)
keyFacts: Epstein was required to have a cellmate after coming off psychological observation on July 30, 2019, but was left without one for approximately 24 hours after his cellmate Efrain Reyes was transferred on August 9.
SHU staff failed to conduct mandatory 30-minute rounds and accurate inmate counts on August 9-10, 2019, as evidenced by discrepant count slips and unfilled round sheets.
The camera system in the SHU was not recording during the critical period due to ongoing technical issues and a delayed replacement project, despite new equipment being onsite since October 2018.
An unmonitored phone call was provided to Epstein on August 9, 2019, on a legal line, which was a breach of protocol as it should have been monitored for security.
The BOP's after-action report identified multiple systemic failures, including lack of a fail-safe system to ensure Epstein had a cellmate, staff not making rounds, and camera deficiencies.
